p: The chemical composition of olive oil varies depending on the extraction technology that is applied in order to obtain oil form the fruits ( Figure 1). The process of extraction of olive oil depends on crushing olives and then separating the oil from the fruit pulp under elevated pressure. Additionally, olive oil can be extruded, post-pressured, re-pressed with or without the use of hot water. The olive oil obtained from this kind of process is usually characterized by stronger color intensity, weaker aroma, and a higher content of free fatty acids [ 12, 13, 14].
